TopicTitle: KSP turns into a complete lagfest after 5-20 minutes of play

Articles.Content:
Hey all,

I am running out of ideas here. Hadn't played in a while and I decided to start up KSP again. I happily played for 5 minutes first time around.. boom uncontrollable lagfest out of nowhere. I restart KSP and it starts laggy. After restarting the PC 15 minutes of happy space time, and back to lagging. Restarted my laptop and reinstalled a vanilla version of KSP and again the same problem. The only thing I can think of that changed with my system since the last time I played is the latest Nvidia Gforce driver. I have tried pretty much everything. There's enough RAM left, my CPU isn't running at 100% either. I am lost. Anybody an idea?
Please fill out the steps listed here so we can have a better idea of the problem you might be experiencing.

1 hour ago, DuoDex said:

Please fill out the steps listed here so we can have a better idea of the problem you might be experiencing.

Quite the list.. I'll have a look at it tomorrow

The change to the graphics driver is an obvious suspect, you may want to check that.

Fine for a bit then lagging suggests a thermal issue, monitor your temperatures as you play.

OK, so I managed to pinpoint it down to a process called Microsoft (c) Windows (c) Operating System. It eats about 15% of my CPU, and the moment I switch it off things are good. Malware maybe?

W

Not heard of that one, but it's possible, some malware that isn't sophisticated enough to hide itself completely can just pretend to be a legit program.

Better do a full scan just in case it's persistent or has friends, malwarebytes is probably your best bet for removing stuff like that.

And with a name like that it's pretty impossible to Google as well. I only found one mention in a forum somewhere. I'll scan my pc when I get back home. Left KSP running to see if it would pop up again. I'll let you know if I find something.
Definitely sounds dodgy, I've never seen a process named that before. Windows's own processes usually have slightly more descriptive names.
